column4: He guys, have any of you tried this it really rocks "GNOME Main Menu"
here is a guide if your interested http://angelicpenguins.blogspot.com/2006/07/sled-menu-for-ubuntu-uslab-now-in-repo_14.html
thats pretty cool is that a package?
yeah and it very very functional
other packages for your consideration which really help productivity in ubuntu "Beagle" and "deskbar"
familar with those just not that menu thats pretty nice.  I guess thats what gnome is trying to go to anyways
yeah, although I still love the simplicity of gnome in its current state... I guess these things add great visual appeal and still remain lightweight and functional
not yet i'll check it out later
Im using the "k7" kernal on dapper will edgy pull down the appropriate kernal during upgrade
although it does ship with aiglx
if so is it enabled by default, I have direct rendering enabled for my ati radeon 9250 will this still be enabled after the upgrade
you may have to reinstall what ever ati drivers you had.  Worst case scenario
does not sound to bad, the default dapper drivers worked fine
